summary:
I am an Engineer with more than 15 years of experience on software systems specification, design, development and operations. 

For the last 8 years I've been working on the Aerospace Industry. I’ve gained wide experience on the full cycle of the software systems engineering process. Along these years I have had different roles, beginning as a software developer and now being Head of Simulators development Area.

 I am specialized in the design and development of S/C simulators, Mission simulators and other Ground Segment software, like Production Pipeline simulation and S/C SAR Payload analysis tool.  Currently at INVAP I am regarded as an expert on these areas, having an active participation with the S/C systems engineering team giving support along the entire systems engineering process. I have a leading role on the definition and design of different software products, bringing broader view on the software being developed and the systems and subsystems to which it interfaces. 

Among my strengths and skills are a highly systemic approach to the problems, with a multidisciplinary view; excellent response under pressure and tight schedules; team leadership and client/provider negotiation capacities.

Besides my professional career I am passionate about Astrophysics, trying to educate myself on topics like stellar formation and evolution.

projects.title: Saocom Mission Simulator
projects.description:
This is a simulator of the SAOCOM Mission.
Unlike the Satellite Simulator (TOMS, see Saocom Satellite Simulator Project), this one simulates the complete mission, from Ground Segment to Flight Segment.
The level of precision of the models is such that it is possible to simulate mainly the generation of mission operation plans for multiple satellites, the command upload and product generation.

This simulator is also used to validate the actual operation plans before they are used in the real system.

During the project I had the role of Team Leader and Architecture Manager.

projects.title: Saocom Satellite Simulator
projects.description:
Simulator of the SAOCOM Satelite. (A LEO Satelite with a L Band SAR Radar) 

This is a simulator of TOMS type (Training, Operations and Maiteinance Simulator).
This kind of simulator requires the modeling of all the subsystems of the ship, with a different level of precision according to the operational requirement.
For this reason, when building it, it is necessary to know all the subsystems, especially to lead the design and development.

Throughout the project my role in it was changing.
At first I was responsible for modeling the power and thermal subsystems. Then I became the leader of the development team (for this and another projects) and in the last years I was responsible for the entire workpackage.

The simulator was used successfully to train operators for SAOCOM 1A and SAOCOM 1B missions. Once launched, the simulators will remain to be used with mission mainteinance objectives.

During this project I had the opportunity to interact with multiple stakeholders, including users (operators), subsystem experts, client (aerospace agency)

projects.title: ConfigSAR (SW)
projects.description:
The SW Configsar was developed as part of the SAOCOM project.
Configsar is a satellite payload configuration SW (L-band SAR Radar). To take pictures, the payload needs a complex configuration that indicates to every single one of its components how it should behave to take an image (called an acquisition).
The SW Configsar is responsible for interpreting what type of acquisition you want to perform (stripmap, topsar, etc.) and assembles the corresponding configuration tables.

During the project I had the role of workpackage owner, technical leader and main developer.
In order to design the SW it was necessary to understand the operation of a SAR radar, to understand the full operation of the Payload, and to model the behavior of the payload in SW in order to ensure its correct operation.

projects.title: ARSAT Satellite Simulator
projects.description:
Like the SAOCOM Simulator, this simulator is also a TOMS (See Saocom Simulator for more information)

Unlike SAOCOM, in this case the simulated satellite is of a GEO with a communications paylod.
During the project I had the role of workpackage owner and main developer.

The Simulator was used successfully for the training of operators of ARSAT 1 and ARSAT 2 and is still being used.
